26.Faridul Haque: Say, "Allah well knows how long they stayed; for Him only are the hidden of the heavens and the earth; how well He sees and hears! They do not have any supporter besides Him; and He does not associate anyone in His command."

27.Faridul Haque: And recite the Book of your Lord which has been divinely revealed to you; there is none who can change His Words; and you will never find a refuge besides Him

28.Faridul Haque: And restrain yourself along with those who pray to their Lord morning and evening, seeking His pleasure; and may not your sight fall on anything besides them; would you desire the adornment of the life of this world? And do not follow him whose heart We have made neglectful of Our remembrance – the one who has followed his own desires and his matter has crossed the limits

29.Faridul Haque: And proclaim, “The Truth is from your Lord”; so whoever wills may accept faith, and whoever wills may disbelieve - We have indeed prepared for the disbelievers a fire the walls of which will surround them; if they plead for water, their plea will be answered with water like molten metal which shall scald their faces; what an evil drink it is; and what an evil destination is hell

30.Faridul Haque: Indeed those who believed and did good deeds - We do not waste the reward of those whose deeds are good

31.Faridul Haque: For them are everlasting Gardens of Eden, beneath which rivers flow - in it they will be given bracelets of gold to adorn, and shall wear green clothes made of fine silk and gold embroidery, reclining upon thrones in it; what an excellent reward; and what an excellent abode is Paradise

32.Faridul Haque: And relate to them the account of the two men - to one We gave two gardens of grapes, and covered them with date-palms and kept farms between them

33.Faridul Haque: Both the gardens gave yields and gave no shortfall in it - and We made a river to flow between the two

34.Faridul Haque: And he had fruit; he therefore said to his companion - and he used to debate with him - "I exceed you in wealth, and am more powerful in respect of men."

35.Faridul Haque: He went into his garden and wronging himself said, "I do not think that this will ever perish."

36.Faridul Haque: "I do not think that the Last Day will ever be established - and even if I return to my Lord I will surely find a haven better than this garden."

37.Faridul Haque: His companion debating with him answered, "What! You disbelieve in Him Who has created you from dust, then from a drop of liquid, and then created you as a complete man?"

38.Faridul Haque: "But I just say that only Allah is my Lord, and I do not ascribe anyone as a partner to my Lord."

39.Faridul Haque: “And why was it not that you would have said when you entered your garden, ‘Whatever Allah wills - we do not have any strength except with the help of Allah’ - if you had observed me lesser than you in wealth and children?”

40.Faridul Haque: "So it is likely that my Lord will give me a garden better than yours, and send bolts of lightning from the skies on your garden - it therefore turns into a barren plain."

41.Faridul Haque: "Or its water may sink into the earth, so you may never be able to find it."

42.Faridul Haque: And his fruits were surrounded - he therefore remained helplessly wringing his hands upon all that he had spent on it - and it lay fallen on its canopy - and he says, "If only I had not ascribed any partner to my Lord!"

43.Faridul Haque: And he had no group to help him against Allah, nor was he capable of taking revenge

44.Faridul Haque: Here brought to light is that the authority is only for Allah, the True; the reward He bestows is the best, and believing in Him has the best outcome

45.Faridul Haque: And relate to them the example of the life of this world - like water which We sent down from the sky, therefore vegetation of the earth grew forth in abundance with it to become dry hay which the winds scatter; and Allah is the Controller of all things

46.Faridul Haque: Wealth and sons are ornaments of the life of this world; and good deeds that last - their reward is better before your Lord, and are better in respect of hope

47.Faridul Haque: And the Day when We move the hills and you see the earth flattened plain, and We shall raise all of them together - so not leaving out any one of them

48.Faridul Haque: And everyone shall be presented before your Lord in rows; "Indeed you have come to Us exactly as We had created you for the first time - in fact you thought that We shall never appoint a promised time for you!"

49.Faridul Haque: And the Book shall be placed - and you will see the guilty dreading what is written in it and saying, "Woe to us - what sort of a Book is this that it has not left out any small sin nor a great one, which it has not included!" And they found all that they did confronting them; and your Lord does not wrong any one

50.Faridul Haque: And recall when We commanded the angels that, "Prostrate before Adam" - so they all prostrated, except Iblis; he was of the jinn, he therefore rebelled against his Lord’s command; "What! You choose him and his offspring as your friends instead of Me, whereas they are your enemies?" And what an evil alternative did the unjust get

51.Faridul Haque: Neither did I make them witness the creations of the heavens and the earth, nor witness their own creation; nor does it befit My Majesty to choose misleaders as aides

52.Faridul Haque: And the Day when He will proclaim, "Call those partners of Mine whom you had assumed" - so they will call out to them - they will not answer them, and We shall create a field of destruction between them

53.Faridul Haque: And when the guilty see hell, they will be certain of falling into it, and will find no place to escape from it

54.Faridul Haque: And We have indeed illustrated all kinds of examples for mankind in this Qur’an; and man is the most quarrelsome of all

55.Faridul Haque: And what prevented men from accepting faith when guidance came to them, and from asking forgiveness from their Lord except that the tradition of the former nations come upon them or that they confront various kinds of punishments

56.Faridul Haque: And We do not send the Noble Messengers except as Heralds of glad tidings and warnings; and the disbelievers debate by means of falsehood to drive away the Truth with it, and they took My signs and warnings they were given, as a mockery

57.Faridul Haque: And who is more unjust than one who, when reminded of the signs of his Lord, turns away from them and forgets what his hands have sent forward? We have put covers on their hearts so as not to understand the Qur’an, and deafness in their ears; and even if you call them to guidance, they will never attain the right path

58.Faridul Haque: And your Lord is the Oft Forgiver, the Merciful; if He seized them for their deeds, He would soon send the punishment upon them; but for them is an appointed time from which they will not find any refuge

59.Faridul Haque: And these towns - We destroyed them when they committed injustice, and We had set an appointed time for their destruction

60.Faridul Haque: And recall when Moosa said to his assistant, “I will not give up until I reach the place where the two seas meet or until I have progressed for ages.”

61.Faridul Haque: And when they reached the place where the two seas meet, they forgot about their fish, and it took its way into the sea, making a tunnel. (The dead fish came alive and went into the water.

62.Faridul Haque: So when they had gone beyond that place, Moosa said to his assistant, “Bring our breakfast - we have indeed faced great exertion in this journey of ours.”

63.Faridul Haque: He said, “Just imagine - when we had taken shelter near the rock, so indeed I forgot the fish; and none but Satan caused me to forget to mention it; and the fish took its way into the sea - its amazing!”

64.Faridul Haque: Said Moosa, "This is exactly what we wanted"; so they came back retracing their steps

65.Faridul Haque: So they found a bondman * from amongst Our (chosen) bondmen, to whom We had given mercy from Us, and had bestowed the inspired knowledge from Ourselves. (* Hazrat Khidr - peace be upon him.

66.Faridul Haque: Moosa said to him, "May I stay with you upon the condition that you will teach me the righteousness that you have been taught?"

67.Faridul Haque: He said, "You will never be able to patiently stay with me."

68.Faridul Haque: "And how will you bear something which your knowledge does not encompass?"

69.Faridul Haque: Said Moosa, "Allah willing, you will soon find me patient and I will not do anything against your instructions."

70.Faridul Haque: He said, "Therefore if you stay with me, do not ask me about anything until I myself mention it to you."

71.Faridul Haque: So they both set out; until when they had boarded the boat, the chosen bondman ruptured the boat; said Moosa, "Did you make a hole in the boat in order to drown its passengers? You have indeed done an evil thing."

72.Faridul Haque: He said, "Did I not say that you will never be able to patiently stay with me?"

73.Faridul Haque: Said Moosa, "Do not apprehend me upon my forgetting, and do not impose difficulty on me in my task."

74.Faridul Haque: So they set out again; until when they met a boy, the chosen bondman slew him - Moosa said, "Did you slay an innocent soul not in retribution for another? You have indeed done an extremely evil thing."

75.Faridul Haque: He said, "Did I not tell you that you will never be able to patiently stay with me?"

76.Faridul Haque: Said Moosa, "If I ask you anything after this, do not stay with me; indeed your condition from me is fulfilled."

77.Faridul Haque: So they both set out again; until they came to the people of a dwelling – they asked its people for food - they refused to invite them – then in the village they both found a wall about to collapse, and the chosen bondman straightened it; said Moosa, "If you wished, you could have taken some wages for it!"

78.Faridul Haque: He said, "This is the parting between you and me; I shall now tell you the interpretation of the matters you could not patiently bear."

79.Faridul Haque: "In respect of the boat - it belonged to the poor people who worked on the river, so I wished to flaw it - and behind them was a king who would capture every sound ship."

80.Faridul Haque: "And in respect of the boy - his parents were Muslims and we feared that he may incite them to rebellion and disbelief."

81.Faridul Haque: "So we wished that their Lord may bestow them a child - better, purer and nearer to mercy."

82.Faridul Haque: "And in respect of the wall - it belonged to two orphan boys of the city, and beneath it was their treasure, and their father was a virtuous man; therefore your Lord willed that they should reach their maturity and remove their treasure; by the mercy of your Lord; and I have not done this at my own command; this is the interpretation of the matters you could not patiently bear." (* Hazrat Khidr was given the knowledge of the hidden - as in all three explanations he gave)

83.Faridul Haque: And they ask you regarding Zul-Qarnain; say, "I shall recite his story to you."

84.Faridul Haque: Indeed We gave him authority in the land and bestowed him the means of everything

85.Faridul Haque: He therefore pursued a purpose

86.Faridul Haque: To the extent that when he reached the setting-place of the sun, he found it setting in a muddy spring, and found a nation there; We said, "O Zul-Qarnain – either punish them or choose kindness for them."

87.Faridul Haque: He submitted, "Regarding one who has done injustice, we shall soon punish him – he will then be brought back to his Lord, Who will punish him severely."

88.Faridul Haque: "And regarding one who believed and did good deeds – so his reward is goodness; and we shall soon give him an easy command."

89.Faridul Haque: He again pursued a purpose

90.Faridul Haque: To the extent that when he reached the rising-place of the sun, he found it rising upon a nation for which We had not kept any shelter from it

91.Faridul Haque: So it is; and Our knowledge encompasses all that he possessed

92.Faridul Haque: He again pursued a purpose

93.Faridul Haque: Until, when he came between two mountains, he found before them a nation that did not appear to understand any speech

94.Faridul Haque: They said, "O Zul-Qarnain - indeed Yajuj and Majuj * are spreading chaos in the land – so shall we assign for you a consideration upon the condition that you set up a wall between us and them?" (* Gog and Magog.

95.Faridul Haque: He said, "That which my Lord has given me control over is better, therefore help me with strength - I shall set up a barrier between you and them."

96.Faridul Haque: "Give me sheets of iron"; until when he had raised the wall equal to the edge of the two mountains, he said, "Blow"; to the extent that he made it ablaze - he said, "Bring me molten copper to pour upon it."

97.Faridul Haque: Therefore Yajuj and Majuj were neither able to surmount it, nor could they pierce it

98.Faridul Haque: He said, "This is the mercy of my Lord; then when the promise of my Lord arrives, He will blow it to bits; and my Lord’s promise is true."

99.Faridul Haque: And on that day We shall release them in groups surging like waves one after another, and the Trumpet will be blown – so We shall gather them all together. (* Gog and Magog will come out during the time of Eisa (Jesus - when he comes back to earth) and cause great destruction in the land.

100.Faridul Haque: And We shall bring hell in front of the disbelievers

101.Faridul Haque: The ones whose eyes were covered from My remembrance, and who could not bear to hear Truth

102.Faridul Haque: Do the disbelievers assume that they will be able to choose My bondmen as supporters other than Me? Indeed We have prepared hell to welcome the disbelievers

103.Faridul Haque: Say (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him), "Shall we inform you whose are the most failed works?"

104.Faridul Haque: "Of those whose efforts are lost in (pursuit of) the life of this world, and they think that they are doing good deeds."

105.Faridul Haque: The people who disbelieved in the signs of their Lord and in the meeting with Him, therefore all their deeds are in vain –We shall therefore not establish any weighing for them on the Day of Resurrection

106.Faridul Haque: This is their reward – hell - because they disbelieved, and made a mockery of My verses and My Noble Messengers

107.Faridul Haque: Indeed those who believed and did good deeds – their welcome are the Gardens of Paradise

108.Faridul Haque: They will abide in it for ever, never wanting to shift from it

109.Faridul Haque: Proclaim, "If the sea became ink for the Words of my Lord, the sea would indeed be used up and the Words of my Lord would never - even if we bring another like it for help."

110.Faridul Haque: Proclaim, "Physically I am a human * like you - my Lord sends divine revelations to me - that your God is only One God; so whoever expects to the meet his Lord must perform good deeds and not ascribe anyone as a partner in the worship of his Lord." (* Human but not equal to you, in fact the greatest in spiritual status.

1.Faridul Haque: Kaf-Ha-Ya-A’in-Sad. (* Alphabets of the Arabic language - Allah and to whomever He reveals know their precise meanings.

2.Faridul Haque: This is the remembrance of the mercy of your Lord upon His bondman Zakaria

3.Faridul Haque: When he softly prayed to his Lord

4.Faridul Haque: He submitted, "O my Lord - my bones have become weak and old age shines forth from my head, and O my Lord, I have never been disappointed in my prayer to you."

5.Faridul Haque: "And I fear my relatives after me and my wife is barren therefore bestow upon me from Yourself one who will take up my work."

6.Faridul Haque: "He being my successor and the heir of the Descendants of Yaqub (Jacob); and my Lord, make him a cherished * one." (* Make him a Prophet among the Descendants of Israel.

7.Faridul Haque: "O Zakaria! We give you the glad tidings of a son whose name is Yahya (John) - before him, We have not created anyone of this name."

8.Faridul Haque: He submitted, "My Lord - how can I have a son whereas my wife is barren and I have reached infirmity due to old age?"

9.Faridul Haque: He (the angel) said, "So it is; your Lord says, ‘This is easy for Me - in fact I created you before this, at a time when you did not exist.’ "

10.Faridul Haque: He said, "My Lord, give me a sign"; He said, "Your token is that you will not speak to people for three nights, although in proper health."

11.Faridul Haque: He therefore emerged upon his people from the mosque, and told them through gestures, "Keep proclaiming the Purity (of your Lord) morning and evening."

12.Faridul Haque: "O Yahya - hold the Book firmly"; and We gave him Prophethood in his infancy. (Prophet Yahya was only 2 years old at that time.

13.Faridul Haque: And compassion from Ourselves, and chastity; and he was extremely pious

14.Faridul Haque: And was good to his parents and not forceful, nor disobedient

15.Faridul Haque: And peace is upon him the day he was born, and the day he will taste death, and the day he will be raised alive

16.Faridul Haque: And remember Maryam in the Book; when she went away from her family to a place towards east

17.Faridul Haque: So there she screened herself from them; We therefore sent Our Spirit towards her - he appeared before her in the form of a healthy man. (Angel Jibreel – peace be upon him.

18.Faridul Haque: She said, "I seek the refuge of the Most Gracious from you - if you fear God."

19.Faridul Haque: He said, "I am indeed one sent by your Lord; so that I may give you a chaste son."

20.Faridul Haque: She said, "How can I bear a son? No man has ever touched me, nor am I of poor conduct!"

21.Faridul Haque: He said, "So it is; your Lord has said, ‘This is easy for Me’; and in order that We make him a sign for mankind and a Mercy from Us; and this matter has been decreed."

22.Faridul Haque: So she conceived him, and she went away with him to a far place

23.Faridul Haque: Then the pangs of childbirth brought her to the base of the palm-tree; she said, "Oh, if only had I died before this and had become forgotten, unremembered."

24.Faridul Haque: (The angel) Therefore he called her from below her, “Do not grieve - your Lord has made a river flow below you.”

25.Faridul Haque: "And shake the trunk of the palm-tree towards you - ripe fresh dates will fall upon you." (This was a miracle - the date palm was dry and it was winter season.

26.Faridul Haque: "Therefore eat and drink and appease your eyes; so if you meet any person then say, ‘I have pledged a fast (of silence) to the Most Gracious - I will therefore not speak to any person today.’ "

27.Faridul Haque: So carrying him in her arms, she brought him to her people; they said, "O Maryam, you have indeed committed a great evil!"

28.Faridul Haque: "O sister of Haroon, neither was your father an evil man nor was your mother of poor conduct!"

29.Faridul Haque: Thereupon she pointed towards the child; they said, "How can we speak to an infant who is in the cradle?"

30.Faridul Haque: The child proclaimed, "I am Allah’s bondman; He has given me the Book and made me a Herald of the Hidden (a Prophet)."

31.Faridul Haque: "And He has made me blessed wherever I be; and ordained upon me prayer and charity, as long as I live."

32.Faridul Haque: "And has made me good to my mother and not made me forceful, ill-fated."

33.Faridul Haque: "And peace is upon me the day I was born, and on the day I shall taste death, and on the day I will be raised alive."

34.Faridul Haque: This is Eisa (Jesus), the son of Maryam; a true statement, in which they doubt

35.Faridul Haque: It does not befit Allah to appoint someone as His son - Purity is to Him! When He ordains a matter, He just commands it, "Be" - and it thereupon happens

36.Faridul Haque: And said Eisa, "Indeed Allah is my Lord and your Lord - therefore worship Him; this is the Straight Path."

37.Faridul Haque: Then groups among them differed; so ruin is for the disbelievers from the witnessing of a Great Day

38.Faridul Haque: Much will they listen and much will they see, on the Day when they come to Us, but today the unjust are in open error

39.Faridul Haque: And warn them of the Day of Regret when the matter will have been decided; and they are in neglect, and they do not accept faith

40.Faridul Haque: Indeed We shall inherit the earth and all that is on it, and only towards Us will they return

41.Faridul Haque: And remember Ibrahim in the Book; he was very truthful, a Herald of the Hidden (a Prophet)

42.Faridul Haque: When he said to his father, * "O my father - why do you worship one which neither hears nor sees, and cannot benefit you in any way?" (* His uncle Azar.

43.Faridul Haque: "O my father, indeed a knowledge has come to me which did not come to you - therefore follow me, I will show you the Straight Path."

44.Faridul Haque: "O my father, do not be a bondman of the devil; indeed the devil is disobedient towards the Most Gracious."

45.Faridul Haque: "O my father, I fear that a punishment from the Most Gracious may reach you, so you would become a companion of the devil."

46.Faridul Haque: He said, "What! You turn away from my gods, O Ibrahim? If you do not desist, I will certainly stone you, and keep no relation with me for a long while."

47.Faridul Haque: He said, “Stop it - peace be upon you; I shall seek forgiveness for you from my Lord; indeed He is very kind to me.”

48.Faridul Haque: "And I shall remain separated from you and all that you worship other than Allah and shall worship my Lord; possibly, by worshipping my Lord, I will not be amongst the unfortunate.”

49.Faridul Haque: So when he had separated from them and what they worshipped other than Allah, We bestowed him Ishaq and Yaqub; and We made each of them a Herald of the Hidden

50.Faridul Haque: And We gave them Our mercy, and assigned for them a true and high repute

51.Faridul Haque: And remember Moosa in the Book; he was indeed a chosen one, and he was a Noble Messenger, a Herald of the Hidden

52.Faridul Haque: We called him from the right side of the mountain Tur, and brought him close to reveal Our secret

53.Faridul Haque: And with Our mercy We bestowed upon him his brother Haroon, a Prophet

54.Faridul Haque: And remember Ismail in the Book; he was indeed true to his promise and was a Noble Messenger, a Prophet

55.Faridul Haque: He used to command his people to offer prayer and give charity, and was liked by his Lord

56.Faridul Haque: And remember Idrees in the Book; he was indeed very truthful, a Prophet

57.Faridul Haque: And We lifted him to a high position. (Living with soul & body in heaven, after his death.

58.Faridul Haque: It is these upon whom Allah has bestowed favour among the Prophets, from the descendants of Adam; and from those whom We boarded along with Nooh; and from the descendants of Ibrahim and Israel; and from those whom We guided and chose; when the verses of the Most Gracious were recited to them, they fell down, prostrating and weeping. (* Command of Prostration # 5.

59.Faridul Haque: And after them came the unworthy successors who squandered prayer and pursued their own desires, so they will soon encounter the forest of Gai in hell

60.Faridul Haque: Except those who repented and accepted faith and did good deeds - so these will enter heaven, and they will not be deprived * in the least. (* Of their due reward.

61.Faridul Haque: Everlasting Gardens of Eden, which the Most Gracious has promised to His bondmen in the unseen; indeed His promise will come

62.Faridul Haque: They will not hear any lewd talk in it, but only Peace; and in it for them is sustenance, every morning and evening

63.Faridul Haque: It is the Paradise that We will bequeath to those among Our bondmen who remain pious

64.Faridul Haque: (Said Angel Jibreel to Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon them) "And we angels do not come down except by the command of your Lord; to Him only belongs all that is ahead of us and all that is behind us and all that is between them; and your Lord is not forgetful."

65.Faridul Haque: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them - therefore worship Him and be firm in His worship; do you know any other of the same name as His

66.Faridul Haque: And says man, "When I am dead, will I soon be brought forth alive?"

67.Faridul Haque: Does not man remember that We created him before this, and he was non existent

68.Faridul Haque: So by your Lord, We shall assemble them and the devils - all of them - and bring them around hell, fallen on their knees

69.Faridul Haque: We shall then pick out from every group the one who was most arrogant towards the Most Gracious

70.Faridul Haque: Moreover, We well know those who most deserve to be burned in hell

71.Faridul Haque: And there is none among you who shall not pass over hell; this is an obligatory affair, binding upon your Lord. (Allah will make everyone pass over the back of hell - on a thin bridge.

72.Faridul Haque: We shall then rescue the pious - and leave the unjust in it, fallen on their knees

73.Faridul Haque: And when Our clear verses are recited to them, the disbelievers say to the Muslims, "Which group has a better home, and a better alliance?"

74.Faridul Haque: And many a generation We did destroy before them, who exceeded them in wealth and pomp

75.Faridul Haque: Proclaim, "For one in error - so the Most Gracious may give him respite; to the extent that when they see the thing which they are promised - either the punishment or the Last Day; so then they will come to know for whom is the evil rank and whose army is weak."

76.Faridul Haque: And Allah will increase the guidance for those who have received guidance; and good deeds that remain have the best reward before your Lord, and the best outcome

77.Faridul Haque: So have you seen him who denied Our signs and says, "I shall certainly be given wealth and children?"

78.Faridul Haque: Has he seen the Hidden, or has he made a pact with the Most Gracious

79.Faridul Haque: Never; We shall now record what he says and give him a prolonged punishment

80.Faridul Haque: And it is We only Who shall inherit what he says (belongs to him), and he will come to Us, alone

81.Faridul Haque: And they have chosen gods besides Allah, so that they may provide them strength

82.Faridul Haque: Never; soon they will deny ever worshipping them, and will turn into their opponents

83.Faridul Haque: Did you not see that We sent devils upon the disbelievers, so they excite them abundantly

84.Faridul Haque: So do not be impatient for them (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him); We are only completing their number. * (* The number of days left for them or their evil deeds.

85.Faridul Haque: On the day when We shall assemble the righteous towards the Most Gracious, as guests

86.Faridul Haque: And drive the guilty towards hell, thirsty

87.Faridul Haque: People do not own the right to intercede, except those * who have made a covenant with the Most Gracious. (* The Holy Prophets and virtuous people will be given the permission to intercede. Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him - will be the first to intercede.

88.Faridul Haque: And the disbelievers said, "The Most Gracious has chosen an offspring."

89.Faridul Haque: You have indeed brought an extremely grave speech

90.Faridul Haque: The heavens are close to being torn apart by it, and the earth being split asunder, and the mountains succumbing and falling down

91.Faridul Haque: Due to their ascribing of an offspring to the Most Gracious

92.Faridul Haque: And it does not befit the Most Gracious to choose an offspring

93.Faridul Haque: All those who are in the heavens and the earth will come to the Most Gracious as His bondmen

94.Faridul Haque: He knows their number and has counted each one of them

95.Faridul Haque: And each one of them will come before Him on the Day of Resurrection, alone

96.Faridul Haque: Indeed those who believed and did good deeds - the Most Gracious will appoint love for them. (In the hearts of other believers.

97.Faridul Haque: We have therefore made this Qur’an easy upon your tongue, (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him) for you to announce glad tidings with it to those who fear, and warn those who are quarrelsome

98.Faridul Haque: And many a generation We did destroy before them; do you see any one of them or hear their faintest sound

1.Faridul Haque: Ta-Ha.* (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him) (Alphabets of the Arabic language - Allah and to whomever He reveals know their precise meanings.

2.Faridul Haque: We have not sent down this Qur’an upon you (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him) for you to fall into hardship! (Either because he used to pray at length during the night or because he was distressed due to the disbelievers not accepting faith.

3.Faridul Haque: Except as a reminder for one who fears

4.Faridul Haque: Sent down by One Who created the earth and the lofty heavens

5.Faridul Haque: The Most Gracious Who, befitting His Majesty, took to the Throne (of control)

6.Faridul Haque: To Him only belongs all whatever is in the heavens and all whatever is in the earth, and all whatever is between them, and all whatever is beneath this wet soil

7.Faridul Haque: And if you speak aloud - so He surely knows the secret and that which is more concealed

8.Faridul Haque: Allah - there is no worship except for Him; His only are the best names

9.Faridul Haque: And did the news of Moosa reach you

10.Faridul Haque: When he saw a fire and said to his wife, "Wait - I have seen a fire - perhaps I may bring you an ember from it or find a way upon the fire."

11.Faridul Haque: So when he came near the fire, it was announced, "O Moosa!"

12.Faridul Haque: "Indeed I am your Lord, therefore take off your shoes; indeed you are in the holy valley of Tuwa!"

13.Faridul Haque: "And I have chosen you, therefore listen carefully to what is divinely revealed to you."

14.Faridul Haque: "Indeed it is Me, Allah - there is no God except I - therefore worship Me and keep the prayer established for My remembrance."

15.Faridul Haque: "The Last Day will surely come - it was close that I hide it from all - in order that every soul may get the reward of its effort." (He revealed it to His Prophets, so that people may fear and get ready. The exact time is not revealed to the people.

16.Faridul Haque: "Therefore never let one, who does not accept faith in it and follows his own desires, prevent you from accepting this, so then you become ruined."

17.Faridul Haque: "And what is this in your right hand, O Moosa?"

18.Faridul Haque: He said, "This is my staff; I support myself on it, and I knock down leaves for my sheep with it, and there are other uses for me in it."

19.Faridul Haque: He said, "Put it down, O Moosa

20.Faridul Haque: So Moosa put it down - thereupon it became a fast moving serpent

21.Faridul Haque: He said, "Pick it up and do not fear; We shall restore it to its former state."

22.Faridul Haque: "And put your hand inside your armpit - it will come out shining white, not due to any illness - one more sign."

23.Faridul Haque: "In order that We may show you Our great signs."

24.Faridul Haque: "Go to Firaun, he has rebelled."

25.Faridul Haque: Said Moosa, "My Lord, open up my breast for me."

26.Faridul Haque: "And make my task easy for me."

27.Faridul Haque: "And untie the knot of my tongue."

28.Faridul Haque: "In order that they may understand my speech."

29.Faridul Haque: "And appoint for me a viceroy from among my family."

30.Faridul Haque: "That is Haroon, my brother."

31.Faridul Haque: "Back me up with him."

32.Faridul Haque: "And make him a partner in my task."

33.Faridul Haque: "In order that we may profusely proclaim Your Purity."

34.Faridul Haque: "And profusely remember You."

35.Faridul Haque: "Indeed You see us."

36.Faridul Haque: He said, "O Moosa, you have been granted your prayer."

37.Faridul Haque: "And indeed We had bestowed upon you a favour one more time."

38.Faridul Haque: "When We inspired in your mother’s heart whatever was to be inspired."

39.Faridul Haque: "That, ‘Put him into a chest and cast it into the river, so the river shall deposit it on to a shore - therefore one who is an enemy to Me and you, shall pick him up’; and I bestowed upon you love from Myself; and for you to be brought up in My sight."

40.Faridul Haque: "When your sister went, then said, ‘Shall I show you the people who may nurse him?’ And We brought you back to your mother in order to soothe her eyes and that she may not grieve; and you killed a man, so We freed you from sorrow, and tested you to the maximum; you therefore stayed for several years among the people of Madyan; then you came (here) at an appointed time, O Moosa."

41.Faridul Haque: "And I created you especially for Myself."

42.Faridul Haque: "You and your brother, both go with My signs, and do not slacken in My remembrance."

43.Faridul Haque: "Both of you go to Firaun; he has indeed rebelled."

44.Faridul Haque: "And speak to him courteously, that perhaps he may ponder or have some fear."

45.Faridul Haque: They both submitted, "Our Lord - indeed we fear that he may oppress us or deal mischievously."

46.Faridul Haque: He said, "Do not fear - I am with you, All Hearing and All Seeing."

47.Faridul Haque: "Therefore go to him and say, ‘We are the sent ones of your Lord, therefore let the Descendants of Israel go with us, and do not trouble them; we have indeed brought to you a sign from your Lord; and peace be upon him who follows the guidance.’

48.Faridul Haque: ‘It has indeed been revealed to us that the punishment is upon the one who denies and turns away.’ "

49.Faridul Haque: Said Firaun, "So who is the Lord of you both, O Moosa?"

50.Faridul Haque: He said, "Our Lord is One Who gave everything its proper shape, then showed the path."

51.Faridul Haque: Said Firaun, "What is the state of the former generations?"

52.Faridul Haque: He said, "Their knowledge is with my Lord, (recorded) in a Book; my Lord neither strays nor forgets."

53.Faridul Haque: The One Who has made the earth a bed for you and kept operative roads for you in it and sent down water from the sky; so with it We produced different pairs of vegetation

54.Faridul Haque: Eat, and graze your cattle; indeed in this are signs for people of intellect

55.Faridul Haque: From the earth We have created you, and to it We shall return you, and from it We shall raise you again

56.Faridul Haque: And indeed We showed him all Our signs - so he denied them and did not accept

57.Faridul Haque: He said, "Have you come to us in order to expel us from our land by your magic, O Moosa?"

58.Faridul Haque: "So we will also produce before you a similar magic, therefore set up an agreed time between us and you, from which neither we nor you shall turn away, at a level place."

59.Faridul Haque: Said Moosa, "Your meeting is the day of the festival, and that the people be assembled at late morning."

60.Faridul Haque: So Firaun went away and gathered his schemes,* then came. (* 72000 magicians and their materials.

61.Faridul Haque: Moosa said to them, "Ruin is to you - do not fabricate a lie against Allah, that He may destroy you by a punishment; and indeed one who fabricates lies has failed."

62.Faridul Haque: So they differed with one another in their task, and secretly conferred

63.Faridul Haque: They said, "Undoubtedly these two are magicians for sure, who wish to expel you from your land by the strength of their magic, and destroy your exemplary religion!"

64.Faridul Haque: "Therefore strengthen your scheme, and come forth in rows; indeed whoever dominates this day has succeeded."

65.Faridul Haque: They said, "O Moosa, either you throw first - or shall we throw first?"

66.Faridul Haque: He said, "Rather, you may throw"; thereupon their cords and their staves, by the strength of their magic, appeared to him as if they were (serpents) moving fast

67.Faridul Haque: And Moosa sensed fear in his heart

68.Faridul Haque: We said, "Do not fear - it is you who is dominant."

69.Faridul Haque: "And cast down which is in your right hand - it will devour all that they have fabricated; what they have made is only a magician’s deceit; and a magician is never successful, wherever he comes."

70.Faridul Haque: Therefore all the magicians were thrown down prostrate - they said, "We accept faith in the One Who is the Lord of Haroon and Moosa."

71.Faridul Haque: Said Firaun, "You accepted faith in him before I permitted you! He is indeed your leader who taught you magic; I therefore swear, I will cut off your hands and your legs from alternate sides, and crucify you on the trunks of palm-trees, and you will surely come to know among us two, whose punishment is more severe and more lasting."

72.Faridul Haque: They said, "We shall never prefer you above the clear proofs that have come to us from the One Who has created us - therefore carry out what you want to; only in the life of this world will you be able to!"

73.Faridul Haque: "Indeed we have accepted faith in our Lord, so that He may forgive us our sins and the magic which you forced us to perform; and Allah is Better, and the Most Lasting."

74.Faridul Haque: Indeed the one who comes guilty to his Lord - so undoubtedly for him is hell; neither dying nor living in it

75.Faridul Haque: And the one who presents himself as a believer before Him, having done good deeds - so for them are the high ranks

76.Faridul Haque: Everlasting Gardens of Eden beneath which rivers flow, abiding in them for ever; and this is the reward of one who became pure

77.Faridul Haque: And We divinely inspired Moosa that, "Journey with My bondmen in a part of the night and strike a dry path in the sea for them, you shall have no fear of Firaun getting to you, nor any danger."

78.Faridul Haque: So Firaun went after them with his army - therefore the sea enveloped them, the way it did

79.Faridul Haque: And Firaun led his people astray, and did not guide them

80.Faridul Haque: O Descendants of Israel, indeed We rescued you from your enemy, and We made a covenant with you on the right side of Mount Tur, and sent down Manna and Salwa upon you

81.Faridul Haque: "Eat the good clean things We have provided you, and do not exceed the limits in respect of it causing My wrath to descend upon you; and indeed the one on whom My wrath descended, has fallen."

82.Faridul Haque: And indeed I am Most Oft Forgiving for him who repented and accepted faith and did good deeds, and then remained upon guidance

83.Faridul Haque: “And why did you come in haste ahead of your people, O Moosa?”

84.Faridul Haque: He submitted, "They are here, just behind me - and O my Lord, I hastened towards You, in order to please You."

85.Faridul Haque: He said, "We have therefore tried your people after you came, and Samri has led them astray."

86.Faridul Haque: So Moosa turned back to his people, angry and grieving; he said, "O my people, had not your Lord given you a good promise? Did a long time pass away for you, or did you wish that your Lord’s wrath come upon you, therefore you broke your promise with me?"

87.Faridul Haque: They said, "We did not renege on our promise to you on our own will, but we were made to carry the burdens of ornaments of the people, so we cast them - and similarly did Samri cast."

88.Faridul Haque: He therefore made a calf for them - a lifeless body, making sounds like a cow - so they said, "This is your God and the God of Moosa; whereas Moosa has forgotten."

89.Faridul Haque: So do they not see that it does not answer to any of their speech? And has no power to cause them any harm or benefit

90.Faridul Haque: And undoubtedly Haroon had told them before it that, "O my people - you have needlessly fallen into trial because of this; and indeed your Lord is the Most Gracious, therefore follow me and obey my command."

91.Faridul Haque: They said, "We will continue to squat * before it, till Moosa returns to us." (* Continue worshipping it.

92.Faridul Haque: Said Moosa, "O Haroon - what prevented you when you saw them going astray?"

93.Faridul Haque: "That you did not come after me? So did you disobey my order?"

94.Faridul Haque: He said, "O son of my mother, do not clutch my beard nor the hair on my head; I feared that you may say, ‘You have caused a division among the Descendants of Israel and did not wait for my advice.’ "

95.Faridul Haque: Said Moosa, "And what is your explanation, O Samri?"

96.Faridul Haque: He said, "I witnessed what the people did not witness – I therefore took a handful from the tracks * of the angel, then threw it ** - and this is what seemed pleasing to my soul." (* The marks left behind by the mount of Angel Jibreel. ** Into the mouth of the calf.

97.Faridul Haque: Said Moosa, "Therefore go away, for in this life your punishment is that you exclaim ‘Do not touch!’* And indeed for you is a time appointed, which you cannot break; and look at your deity, in front of which you remained squatting the whole day; we swear we will surely burn it and, smashing it into bits, discharge it into the river." (* He was cursed with a disease.

98.Faridul Haque: "Your God is only Allah - other than for Whom there is no worship; His knowledge encompasses all things."

99.Faridul Haque: This is how We relate the former tidings to you (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him); and We have given you a Remembrance * from Ourselves. (*The Holy Qur’an.

100.Faridul Haque: Whoever turns away from it, will bear a burden on the Day of Resurrection

101.Faridul Haque: They will remain in it forever - what an evil burden it will be for them on the Day of Resurrection

102.Faridul Haque: On the day when the Trumpet is blown and We shall assemble the guilty on that day, blue -eyed

103.Faridul Haque: Whispering secretly among themselves, "You have not stayed on earth but for ten days."

104.Faridul Haque: We know well what they will utter, whereas the wisest among them will say, "You have stayed just for a day."

105.Faridul Haque: They ask you regarding the mountains; proclaim, "My Lord will blow them into bits and scatter them."

106.Faridul Haque: "Therefore leaving the earth just as an empty plain."

107.Faridul Haque: "In which you shall neither see ups nor downs."

108.Faridul Haque: On that day they will run after a caller, there will be no deviation in it; and voices shall become hushed before the Most Gracious, so you will not hear except a faint sound

109.Faridul Haque: On that day no one’s intercession shall benefit except his to whom the Most Gracious has given permission and whose word He has liked. (The Holy Prophets and virtuous people will be given the permission to intercede. Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him - will be the first to intercede.

110.Faridul Haque: He knows all that is before them and all that is behind them, whereas their knowledge cannot encompass it

111.Faridul Haque: And all faces shall bow before the Living, the All Sustaining; and the one who bore the burden of injustice, has failed

112.Faridul Haque: And the one who does some good deeds, and is a Muslim - he shall have no fear of injustice, nor suffer any loss

113.Faridul Haque: And this is how We revealed it as an Arabic Qur’an, and in different ways gave promises of punishment, that they may fear or it may create some pondering in their hearts

114.Faridul Haque: Therefore Supreme is Allah, the True King; and do not hasten in the Qur’an (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him) until its divine revelation has been completed to you; and pray, "My Lord, bestow me more knowledge."

115.Faridul Haque: And indeed before this We made a covenant with Adam, so he forgot, and We did not find its intention (in him)

116.Faridul Haque: And when We commanded the angels, "Prostrate before Adam" - so they all prostrated, except Iblis; he refused

117.Faridul Haque: We therefore said, "O Adam, he is your and your wife’s enemy, so may he not get you both out from heaven, so you then fall into hardship."

118.Faridul Haque: "Indeed for you in heaven is that you may never be hungry nor be unclothed."

119.Faridul Haque: "And that you never feel thirsty nor hot sunshine hurt you."

120.Faridul Haque: So the devil incited him, saying, "O Adam, shall I show you the tree of immortality and a kingdom that does not erode?"

121.Faridul Haque: So they both ate from it - thereupon their shame became manifest to them, and they started applying on themselves the leaves of heaven; and Adam lapsed in obeying his Lord, so did not reach his goal. (Of achieving immortality

122.Faridul Haque: Then his Lord chose him, and inclined towards him with His mercy, and guided him

123.Faridul Haque: He said, "Both of you go down from heaven, one of you is an enemy to the other; then if the guidance from Me comes to you - then whoever follows My guidance, will not go astray nor be ill-fated."

124.Faridul Haque: "And the one who turned away from My remembrance - for him is a confined existence, and We shall raise him blind on the Day of Resurrection."

125.Faridul Haque: He will say, "O my Lord, why have You raised me blind, whereas I was sighted?"

126.Faridul Haque: He will say, "Similarly did Our signs come to you but you forgot them; and in the same way, nobody will heed you today."

127.Faridul Haque: And this is how We reward him who transgresses and does not accept faith in the signs of his Lord; and indeed the punishment of the Hereafter is the most severe and more lasting

128.Faridul Haque: So did they not gain guidance from (knowing) how many generations We have destroyed before them, among whose dwellings they walk? Indeed in it are signs for men of intellect

129.Faridul Haque: And had not a command of your Lord been passed, then the punishment would have gripped them - and had a term not been appointed

130.Faridul Haque: Therefore (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him), patiently forbear upon their speech, and praising your Lord proclaim His Purity, before the sun rises and before it sets; and proclaim His Purity at some times of the night and at the two ends of the day, in the hope that you be pleased. (*With the great reward from your Lord

131.Faridul Haque: And O listener, do not extend your eyes towards what We have given to disbelieving couples to enjoy - the bloom of the worldly life - so that We may test them with it; and the sustenance of your Lord is the best, and more lasting

132.Faridul Haque: And command your household to establish prayer, and yourself be steadfast in it; We do not ask any sustenance from you; We will provide you sustenance; and the excellent result is for piety

133.Faridul Haque: And the disbelievers said, "Why does he not bring to us a sign from his Lord?"; did not the explanation of what is in the former Books, come to them

134.Faridul Haque: And had We destroyed them with some punishment before the advent of a Noble Messenger, they would have certainly said, "Our Lord, why did You not send a Noble Messenger to us, so we would have followed Your signs, before being humiliated and disgraced?"

135.Faridul Haque: Proclaim, "Each one is waiting; so you too wait; very soon you will come to know who are the people of the right path, and who has attained guidance."

1.Faridul Haque: The people’s reckoning is near, whereas they are in neglect, turned away

2.Faridul Haque: Whenever a new advice comes to them from their Lord, they do not listen to it except while playing

3.Faridul Haque: Their hearts are involved in play; and the unjust secretly conferred, "What is he, except another a human like you?! So do you follow magic although you have perceived?"

4.Faridul Haque: And the Prophet said, "My Lord knows all that is spoken in the heavens and in the earth; and He only is the All Hearing, the All Knowing."

5.Faridul Haque: Rather they said, "These are confused dreams, but in fact he has fabricated it - but in fact he is a poet; so he must bring us some sign, like those who were sent before."

6.Faridul Haque: There is not a township before them which did not believe which We have not destroyed; so will they believe

7.Faridul Haque: And We did not send (Prophets) before you except men, to whom We sent divine revelations - therefore, O people, ask the people of knowledge if you do not know

8.Faridul Haque: And We did not create them without bodies so they would not eat food - nor that they abide on earth forever

9.Faridul Haque: We then fulfilled the promise to them, therefore rescued them and whomever We willed, and destroyed the transgressors

10.Faridul Haque: We have indeed sent down towards you a Book, in which is your repute; so do you not have sense

11.Faridul Haque: And many a township did We destroy, for they were unjust, and We created other nations after them

12.Faridul Haque: And when they tasted Our punishment, they immediately started fleeing from it

13.Faridul Haque: The angels said to them, "Do not flee and return to the comforts that were given to you and to your homes, perhaps you will be questioned."

14.Faridul Haque: They cried, "Woe to us, we were indeed unjust!"

15.Faridul Haque: So they kept saying this until We made them cut off, extinguished

16.Faridul Haque: And We have not created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, unnecessarily

17.Faridul Haque: If We willed to choose a pastime, We could have chosen it from Ourselves - if We wanted to

18.Faridul Haque: But in fact We hurl the truth upon falsehood, so it scatters its brains - thereupon it vanishes; and for you is ruin due to the matters you fabricate

19.Faridul Haque: And to Him only belong all those who are in the heavens and in the earth; and those with Him are not conceited towards worshipping Him, nor do they tire

20.Faridul Haque: They say His Purity night and day, and do not slacken

21.Faridul Haque: Have they appointed from the earth, gods that create something

22.Faridul Haque: If other than Allah, there were gods * in the heavens and the earth, they would be destroyed; therefore Purity is to Allah, Owner of the Throne, from the matters that they fabricate. (* Which is not possible. ** The heavens and the earth.

23.Faridul Haque: He is not questioned whatever He does, whereas they will all be questioned

24.Faridul Haque: Or have they set up other gods besides Allah? Say, "Bring your proof; this is the remembrance of those with me and those before me"; but in fact most of them do not know the Truth, so they turn away

25.Faridul Haque: And We did not send any Noble Messenger before you, but We divinely revealed to him that, "There is no God except I (Allah), therefore worship Me alone."

26.Faridul Haque: And they said, “The Most Gracious has chosen a son” - Purity is to Him! In fact they are honourable bondmen

27.Faridul Haque: They do not speak before He has, and they act only at His command

28.Faridul Haque: He knows what is before them and what is behind them, and they do not intercede except for him whom He likes, and they fear with awe of Him. (The Holy Prophets and virtuous people will be given the permission to intercede. Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him - will be the first to intercede.

29.Faridul Haque: And the one among them who says, "I am a God beside Allah" - We shall reward him with hell; this is how We punish the unjust

30.Faridul Haque: Did not the disbelievers observe that the heavens and the earth were together, so We parted them, and we made every living thing from water? So will they not accept faith

31.Faridul Haque: And We have placed mountains as anchors in the earth so that it may not shake with them; and We kept wide roads in it, so that they may find guidance

32.Faridul Haque: And We have made the sky a roof, protected; and they turn away from its signs

33.Faridul Haque: And it is He Who created the night and the day, and the sun and the moon; each one floats in an orbit

34.Faridul Haque: And before you, We did not appoint on earth a never-ending life for any human; will they, if you depart, become immortal

35.Faridul Haque: Every living being must taste death; and We test you with harm and with good - a trial; and to Us only you have to return

36.Faridul Haque: And when the disbelievers see you, they do not appoint you except as an object of mockery; "Is he the one who speaks ill of your gods?"; whereas they deny the remembrance of the Most Gracious Himself

37.Faridul Haque: Man has been created hasty; very soon I shall show you My signs, do not be impatient

38.Faridul Haque: And they say, "When will this promise occur, if you are truthful

39.Faridul Haque: If only the disbelievers realised the time when they will not be able to stop the fire from their faces and from their backs - and nor are they to be helped

40.Faridul Haque: In fact it will suddenly come upon them, therefore shocking them, and they will not be able to repel it nor will they be given respite

41.Faridul Haque: And indeed the Noble Messengers before you were mocked at, but their mockery ruined the mockers themselves

42.Faridul Haque: Proclaim, "Who guards you night and day from the Most Gracious?" In fact they have turned away from the remembrance of their Lord

43.Faridul Haque: Do they have some gods who protect them from Us? Neither can they save themselves nor save their friends from Us

44.Faridul Haque: But in fact We have given these (disbelievers) and their fathers a benefit to the extent that life became long for them; so do they not see that We are reducing the land from its borders? So will these be victorious

45.Faridul Haque: Proclaim (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him) "I warn you only with the divine revelation; and the deaf do not hear the call when warned."

46.Faridul Haque: And if a whiff of your Lord’s punishment were to touch them, they would certainly say, "Woe to us - we were indeed unjust!"

47.Faridul Haque: And We shall set up the scales of justice on the Day of Resurrection - therefore no soul will be wronged in the least; and if a thing is equal to a grain of mustard seed, We will bring it; and We are Sufficient to (take) account

48.Faridul Haque: And indeed We gave Moosa and Haroon the Judgement * and a light and an advice for the pious. (* The Holy Book Taurat.

49.Faridul Haque: Those who fear their Lord without seeing and who apprehend the Last Day

50.Faridul Haque: This is a blessed remembrance, sent down by Us; so do you deny it

51.Faridul Haque: And indeed We bestowed Ibrahim with guidance from the beginning, and We were Aware of him

52.Faridul Haque: When he said to his father and his people, "What are these idols before whom you squat (worshipping)?"

53.Faridul Haque: They said, "We found our forefathers worshipping them."

54.Faridul Haque: He said, "Indeed you all - you and your forefathers - were in open error."

55.Faridul Haque: They said, "Have you brought the Truth to us, or are you just making fun?"

56.Faridul Haque: He said, "In fact, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the One Who created them; and I am of those who testify to it."

57.Faridul Haque: "And, by oath of Allah, I shall seek to harm your idols after you have gone away and turned your backs."

58.Faridul Haque: He shattered them all, except the biggest among them, that perhaps they may question it

59.Faridul Haque: They said, "Who has done this to our gods? He is indeed cruel!"

60.Faridul Haque: Some among them said, "We heard a youth speak ill of them - the one called Ibrahim."

61.Faridul Haque: They said, "Therefore bring him in front of the people, perhaps they may testify."

62.Faridul Haque: They said, "Did you do this to our gods, O Ibrahim?"

63.Faridul Haque: Said he, "Rather, their chief may have done it; so question them, if they can speak."

64.Faridul Haque: So they turned towards their own selves and (inwardly) said, "Indeed you yourselves are unjust."

65.Faridul Haque: Again they were inverted upon their heads; saying, "You know well that these do not speak."

66.Faridul Haque: He said, "What! You worship, instead of Allah, one that neither benefits you nor harms you?"

67.Faridul Haque: "Disgrace be upon you and all the idols whom you worship instead of Allah; so do you not have sense?"

68.Faridul Haque: They said, "Burn him and help your gods, if you want to."

69.Faridul Haque: We said, "O fire, become cool and peaceful upon Ibrahim."

70.Faridul Haque: And they wished to cause him harm, so We made them the greatest of losers

71.Faridul Haque: And We rescued him and Lut towards the land which We have blessed for the entire world

72.Faridul Haque: And We bestowed him Ishaq, and Yaqub the grandson; and We made all of them worthy of Our proximity

73.Faridul Haque: And We made them leaders who guide by Our command, and We sent them the divine revelation to do good deeds and to keep the prayer established and to give charity; and they used to worship Us

74.Faridul Haque: And We gave Lut the kingdom and knowledge, and We rescued him from the township that committed vile deeds; indeed those evil people were disobedient

75.Faridul Haque: And We admitted him into Our mercy; indeed he is among those who deserve Our proximity

76.Faridul Haque: And before this when Nooh called Us - We therefore heard his prayer and rescued him and his household from the great calamity

77.Faridul Haque: And We helped him against the people who denied Our signs; indeed they were evil people, We therefore drowned them all

78.Faridul Haque: And remember Dawud and Sulaiman, when they were deciding the dispute of a field, when some people’s sheep had strayed into it at night; and We were Present at the time of their deciding

79.Faridul Haque: And We explained the case to Sulaiman; and to both We gave the kingdom and knowledge; and subjected the hills to proclaim the Purity along with Dawud, and (also subjected) the birds; and these were Our works

80.Faridul Haque: And We taught him to make a garment for you, to protect you from your hurt; so will you be thankful

81.Faridul Haque: And We subjected the fast wind for Sulaiman, which moved by his command towards the land in which We have placed blessings; and We know everything

82.Faridul Haque: And among the devils, were those who dived (in water) for him and did works other than this; and We had kept them restrained

83.Faridul Haque: And remember Ayyub (Job), when he called his Lord that, "Hardship has afflicted me, and You are the Most Merciful of all those who have mercy."

84.Faridul Haque: We therefore heard his prayer and removed the adversity that had afflicted him, and We gave him his family and in addition bestowed along with them a similar number, by mercy from Ourselves - and an advice for the people who worship

85.Faridul Haque: And remember Ismail, and Idrees, and Zul-Kifl; they were all patiently enduring

86.Faridul Haque: And We admitted them into Our mercy; indeed they are among those who deserve Our proximity

87.Faridul Haque: And remember Zun-Noon, * when he left in anger, assuming that We would not restrict him - he therefore called out in the realms of darkness, saying, "There is no God except You, Purity is to You; I have indeed committed a lapse." (* Prophet Yunus - peace and blessings upon him

88.Faridul Haque: We therefore heard his prayer and rescued him from grief; and similarly We shall rescue the Muslims

89.Faridul Haque: And remember Zakaria, when he prayed to his Lord, "O my Lord - do not leave me alone, and You are the Best Inheritor

90.Faridul Haque: We therefore heard his prayer; and bestowed him Yahya, and cured his wife for him; indeed they used to hasten to perform good deeds, and pray to Us with hope and fear; and used to weep before Us

91.Faridul Haque: And remember the woman who maintained her chastity, We therefore breathed Our Spirit into her and made her and her son a sign for the entire world

92.Faridul Haque: Indeed this religion of yours, is one religion; and I am your Lord, therefore worship Me

93.Faridul Haque: And others have shattered their works into pieces among themselves; all have to return to Us

94.Faridul Haque: So whoever does some good deeds, and is a believer, then his efforts will not be ignored; and We are recording it

95.Faridul Haque: And it is forbidden for any township which We have destroyed, that they may return. (Once the disbelievers face death, their return to earth is impossible.

96.Faridul Haque: Till the time when Yajuj and Majuj are released, and they will be flowing down from every height

97.Faridul Haque: And the True Promise has come near - thereupon the eyes of the disbelievers will become fixed, staring wide; saying "Woe to us - we were in neglect of this, but in fact we were unjust."

98.Faridul Haque: "Indeed you * and all that you worship ** besides Allah, are the fuel of hell; in it you must go." (* All disbelievers  ** Idols and disbelievers who claimed to be gods. The Prophets like Eisa and Uzair who were worshipped are exempt from this, and so are Maryam, and trees and animals etc.

99.Faridul Haque: "Had these been gods they would not go into hell; and they have to remain in it."

100.Faridul Haque: They will bray in it and not be able to hear anything in it

101.Faridul Haque: Indeed those to whom Our promise of goodness has been made, have been kept far away from hell

102.Faridul Haque: And they will not hear its faintest sound; and they will forever abide in whatever their hearts desire

103.Faridul Haque: The greatest fear will not aggrieve them, and the angels will welcome them; saying "This is your day, which you were promised."

104.Faridul Haque: The day when We shall roll up the heavens as the recording angel rolls up the register of deeds; We shall make him similar to Our making him the first time; this is a promise upon Us; We certainly have to do it

105.Faridul Haque: And indeed We wrote, after the reminder in the Zaboor that, "My virtuous bondmen will inherit the earth."

106.Faridul Haque: This Qur’an is sufficient for people who are devout

107.Faridul Haque: And We did not send you (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him) except as a mercy for the entire world. (Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him – is the Prophet towards all mankind.

108.Faridul Haque: Proclaim, "It is divinely revealed to me that your God is the only One God - Allah; do you therefore become Muslims?"

109.Faridul Haque: Then if they turn away, proclaim, "I have proclaimed a war against you on equal terms; and what do I know whether the promise which is given to you, is close or far?"

110.Faridul Haque: "Indeed Allah knows whatever is said, and knows all what you conceal."

111.Faridul Haque: "And what do I know - it may be a trial for you, and an enjoyment for a time."

112.Faridul Haque: And the Prophet submitted, "My Lord - render the true judgement"; "And only the help of Our Lord, the Most Gracious, is sought against all what you fabricate."

1.Faridul Haque: O people, fear your Lord; indeed the earthquake of the Last Day is a tremendous thing

2.Faridul Haque: On the day when you will witness it, every nursing mother will forget her nurseling and every pregnant one will discharge her burden, and you (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him) will see people as if they are drunk, whereas they will not be intoxicated, but the fact is that Allah’s punishment is very severe

3.Faridul Haque: And among people are some who argue concerning Allah without knowing, and blindly follow every rebellious devil

4.Faridul Haque: (The devil) Upon whom is decreed that whoever befriends him, he will certainly mislead him and show him the path to hell

5.Faridul Haque: O people, if you doubt your revival on the Day of Resurrection, then ponder that We created you from dust, then from a drop of liquid, then from a clot, then from a piece of flesh formed and without form, so that We show you Our signs for you; and We keep whomever We want inside the mothers’ wombs up to an appointed time, then extract you as infants, then in order that you reach your puberty; and among you is one who dies earlier, and among you is one put to the most abject age, so after having knowledge, knows nothing; and you see the earth desolate, then when We sent down water upon it, it freshened up and developed and produced beautiful pairs of all kinds

6.Faridul Haque: This is because Allah only is True and because He will revive the dead, and because He is Able to do all things

7.Faridul Haque: And because the Last Day will come, there is no doubt in it - and because Allah will revive those who are in the graves

8.Faridul Haque: And there is one who argues concerning Allah without having knowledge nor any proof nor a clear text

9.Faridul Haque: With his neck turned away from the truth, in order to deceive from the way of Allah; for him is disgrace in this world and on the Day of Resurrection We shall make him taste the punishment of fire

10.Faridul Haque: "This is the recompense of what your hands have sent ahead, and Allah does not oppress His bondmen."

11.Faridul Haque: And there are some men who worship Allah whilst upon an edge; then if some good occurs to them, they are content; and if some trial comes, they turn way upon their faces; a loss of this world and the Hereafter; and this is the complete loss

12.Faridul Haque: They worship such, beside Allah, which neither harms them nor benefits them; this only is the extreme error

13.Faridul Haque: They worship one from whom harm is expected more than the benefit; indeed what an evil master and indeed what an evil friend

14.Faridul Haque: Indeed Allah will admit those who believed and did good deeds, into Gardens beneath which rivers flow; indeed Allah does whatever He wills

15.Faridul Haque: Therefore whoever assumes that Allah will not assist His Prophet (Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him) in this world and the Hereafter, should extend a rope upwards and hang himself, and then see whether his scheme has taken away what he envies

16.Faridul Haque: And so it is, that We sent down this Qur’an - clear verses - and that Allah guides whomever He wills

17.Faridul Haque: Indeed the Muslims, and the Jews, and the Sabeans, and the Christians and the fire worshippers and the polytheists - indeed Allah will decide between all of them on the Day of Resurrection; indeed Allah witnesses all things

18.Faridul Haque: Did you not see that for Allah prostrate those who are in the heavens and in the earth, and the sun, and the moon, and the stars, and the hills, and the trees, and the beasts, and many among mankind; and there are many upon whom the punishment has been decreed; and he whom Allah disgraces - there is none to give him honour; indeed Allah may do whatever He wills. (Command of Prostration # 6

19.Faridul Haque: These are the two groups who fought concerning their Lord; so those who disbelieved – garments of fire have been fashioned for them; and boiling water will be poured onto their heads

20.Faridul Haque: With which will melt what is in their bellies, and their skins

21.Faridul Haque: And for them are rods of iron

22.Faridul Haque: Whenever they wish to come out of it due to suffocation, they will be returned to it again and it will be commanded, "Taste the punishment of fire!"

23.Faridul Haque: Indeed Allah will admit those who believed and did good deeds into Gardens beneath which rivers flow - in it they will be made to wear armlets of gold, and pearls, and in it their garment is silk

24.Faridul Haque: And they were guided to sacred speech; and they were shown the path of the Most Praiseworthy

25.Faridul Haque: Indeed those who have disbelieved and prevent from the way of Allah and from this Sacred Mosque, which We have appointed for all mankind – its resident and the foreigner have the same rights in it; and whoever wrongfully intends injustice in it - We shall make him taste a painful punishment

26.Faridul Haque: And remember when We showed Ibrahim the right place of the Sacred House (mosque) and commanded that, "Do not ascribe anything as a partner to Me, and keep My House clean for those who encircle it and those who stay in it (for worship) and those who bow and prostrate."

27.Faridul Haque: "And publicly announce the pilgrimage to all people – they will come to you, on foot and on every lean she-camel, coming from every far distant journey." (The announcement by Prophet Ibrahim reached each and every soul.

28.Faridul Haque: In order that they may gain their benefit, and mention the name of Allah on the appointed days as He has bestowed the sustenance to them – the inarticulate animals; therefore eat from them yourself and feed the distressed destitute

29.Faridul Haque: They must then remove their dirt and fulfil their pledges and go around the Free House

30.Faridul Haque: So it is; and whoever reveres the sacred things of Allah – that is then a goodness for him in the sight of his Lord; the inarticulate animals are lawful to you except those the forbidding of which is recited to you, therefore shun the filth of idols, and avoid false speech

31.Faridul Haque: Devoting yourself to Allah, not ascribing any partner to Him; and whoever ascribes partners to Allah is as if he has fallen from the sky and the birds snatch him or the wind blows him away to a far-off place

32.Faridul Haque: So it is; and whoever reveres the symbols of Allah – this is then part of the piety of the hearts

33.Faridul Haque: In the cattle are benefits for you up to a fixed time and then they are to be brought to the Free House

34.Faridul Haque: And for every nation We have appointed a sacrifice, that they may mention the name of Allah over the inarticulate animal which He has provided them; so (remember) your God is One God, therefore submit only to Him; and give glad tidings (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him) to the humble

35.Faridul Haque: Those whose hearts fear when Allah is mentioned, and those who patiently endure whatever befalls them, and those who keep the prayer established, and who spend part of what We have provided to them

36.Faridul Haque: And the large sacrificial animals – the camels and the cows - We have made them among the symbols of Allah, there is goodness for you in them; therefore mention the name of Allah over them with their one leg tied and standing on three feet; then when their flanks have fallen, eat from it yourself and feed the one who patiently awaits, and the beggar; this is how We have given them in your control, so that you be grateful

37.Faridul Haque: Never does their flesh nor their blood reach Allah, but your piety successfully reaches Him; this is how We have given them in your control so that you may speak His Greatness for guiding you; and O dear Prophet (Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him) give glad tidings to the virtuous

38.Faridul Haque: Indeed Allah repels the afflictions of the Muslims; indeed Allah does not like any extremely disloyal ingrate

39.Faridul Haque: Permission is granted to those against whom the disbelievers wage war, as they are being wronged; and indeed Allah is Able to assist them

40.Faridul Haque: Those who were unjustly expelled from their homes just because they said, "Allah is Our Lord"; and had Allah not repelled some men by means of other men, the abbeys, churches, synagogues and mosques - in which the name of Allah is profusely mentioned - would definitely be demolished; and indeed Allah will assist the one who helps His religion; indeed surely Allah is Almighty, Dominant

41.Faridul Haque: The people who, if We give them control in the land, would keep the prayer established and pay charity and enjoin virtue and forbid from evil; and for Allah only is the result of all works

42.Faridul Haque: If they belie you (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him), then indeed the people of Nooh, and the tribes of A’ad and Thamud have belied before them

43.Faridul Haque: And (so did) the people of Ibrahim and the people of Lut

44.Faridul Haque: And the people of Madyan; and Moosa was belied, so I gave the disbelievers respite and then seized them, so how (dreadful) was My punishment

45.Faridul Haque: And many a township did We destroy, for they were oppressors – so they now lie flat on their roofs, and many a well lying useless and many a palace in ruins

46.Faridul Haque: So have they not travelled in the land, to have hearts with which to understand and ears to hear with? So it is not the eyes that are blind, but it is the hearts in the bosoms, that are blind

47.Faridul Haque: And they ask you for the punishment – they are impatient – and Allah will not make His promise untrue; and indeed a single day before Allah is like a thousand years in your calculation

48.Faridul Haque: And to many a township did I give respite although they were oppressors; then I seized them; and towards Me is the return

49.Faridul Haque: Proclaim, "O mankind, I am for you only a clear Herald of Warning."

50.Faridul Haque: So those who believed and did good deeds, for them are forgiveness, and an excellent sustenance

51.Faridul Haque: And those who strive in Our signs with the intention of disputing, are the people of fire

52.Faridul Haque: And all the Noble Messengers or Prophets whom We sent before you – it occurred with all of them – that whenever they recited (the message) Satan included a bit (from his own speech) in their recitation to the people; so Allah obliterates what Satan includes and then Allah fortifies His verses; and Allah is All Knowing, Wise

53.Faridul Haque: So that He may make what the devil includes a trial for those in whose hearts is a disease, and those whose hearts are hardened; indeed the unjust are extremely quarrelsome

54.Faridul Haque: And so that the people given the knowledge may know that it is the truth from your Lord, in order that they may accept faith in it, therefore their hearts may humble before Him; and indeed Allah will guide the believers on the Straight Path

55.Faridul Haque: And the disbelievers will always be in doubt of it, to the extent that the Last Day will suddenly come upon them, or will come upon them the punishment of a day the result of which is not at all good for them

56.Faridul Haque: For Allah only is the kingship on that day; He will judge between them; so those who believed and did good deeds are in Gardens of content

57.Faridul Haque: And those who disbelieved and denied Our signs - for them will be a disgraceful punishment

58.Faridul Haque: And those who left their homes and belongings in Allah's cause and were then killed or died - Allah will therefore indeed provide for them an excellent sustenance; and indeed the sustenance bestowed by Allah is the best

59.Faridul Haque: He will certainly admit them to a place they will love; and indeed Allah is All Knowing, Most Forbearing

60.Faridul Haque: So it is; and whoever retaliates similarly to the affliction he was made to suffer, and then he is wronged again – so Allah will definitely assist him; indeed Allah is Oft Pardoning, Oft Forgiving

61.Faridul Haque: This is because Allah inserts the night into a part of the day and inserts the day into a part of the night, and because Allah is All Hearing, All Seeing

62.Faridul Haque: This is because Allah only is the Truth, and what they worship other than Him, is itself falsehood, and because Allah only is the Supreme, the Great

63.Faridul Haque: Did you not see that Allah sent down water from the sky, so the earth became green at morn? Indeed Allah is Pure, Aware

64.Faridul Haque: To Him only belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth; and indeed Allah only is the Perfect (Not Needing Anything), the Most Praiseworthy

65.Faridul Haque: Did you not see that Allah has given in your control all that is in the earth - and the ship that moves upon the sea by His command? And He restricts the heavens that it may not fall on to the earth except by His command; indeed Allah is Most Compassionate, Most Merciful upon mankind

66.Faridul Haque: And it is He Who gave you life, then will cause you to die, and will then revive you; indeed man is very ungrateful

67.Faridul Haque: For each nation We have made the rules of worship for them to follow - so never should they quarrel with you in this matter – and call them towards your Lord; indeed you are upon the Straight Path

68.Faridul Haque: And if they quarrel with you, say, "Allah well knows your evil deeds."

69.Faridul Haque: Allah will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection concerning what you dispute

70.Faridul Haque: Did you not realise that Allah knows all that is in the heavens and in the earth? Indeed all this is in a Book; indeed this is easy for Allah

71.Faridul Haque: And they worship those instead of Allah regarding whom He has not sent down any proof, and those regarding whom they themselves do not have any knowledge; and there are no supporters for the unjust

72.Faridul Haque: And when Our clear verses are recited to them, you will see traces of anger in the faces of the disbelievers; possibly they may attack those who recite Our verses to them; say, "Shall I show you what is worse than your current state? That is the fire! Allah has promised it to the disbelievers; and what a wretched place to return!"

73.Faridul Haque: O people, an example is being illustrated therefore listen to it attentively; "Those whom you worship besides Allah can never create a fly even if they all come together for it; and if a fly took away something from them, they cannot retrieve that from it; how weak are the seeker and the sought!"

74.Faridul Haque: They did not realise the importance of Allah as was His right; indeed Allah is Almighty, Dominant

75.Faridul Haque: Allah chooses the Noble Messengers from the angels, and from men; indeed Allah is All Hearing, All Seeing

76.Faridul Haque: He knows all that is before them and all that is behind them; and towards Allah is the return of all matters

77.Faridul Haque: O People who Believe, bow and prostrate yourselves, and worship your Lord, and do good deeds in the hope of attaining salvation

78.Faridul Haque: And fight in Allah's cause as is the true manner of fighting; He has preferred you and has not kept any hardship upon you in religion; the religion of your father Ibrahim; Allah has named you Muslims – in the previous Books and in this Qur’an, so that the Noble Messenger be your guardian and witness, and you be witness against other people; therefore keep the prayer established and give charity, and hold fast to the rope of Allah; He is your Master; so what an excellent Master and what an excellent Supporter

1.Faridul Haque: Successful indeed are the believers

2.Faridul Haque: Those who humbly cry in their prayers

3.Faridul Haque: And who do not incline towards indecent matters

4.Faridul Haque: And who pay the (obligatory) charity

5.Faridul Haque: And who guard their private organs

6.Faridul Haque: Except from their wives or the legal bondwomen that they possess, for then there is no blame upon them

7.Faridul Haque: So whoever desires more than these two - they are crossing the limits

8.Faridul Haque: And those who keep proper regard for their trusts and their pledges
