Inspire me to be thankful for the favours you bestowed upon me and my parents, and that I may perform the deeds pleasing to You, and keep merit among my offspring; I have inclined towards you and I am a Muslim.” (* This verse was revealed concerning S. Abu Bakr - the first caliph - may Allah be well pleased with him)

16.Faridul Haque: These are the ones whose good deeds We will accept, and overlook their shortfalls - among the People of Paradise; a true promise which is being given to them

17.Faridul Haque: And the one who said to his parents, “Uff - I am fed up with both of you! What! You promise me that I will be raised again whereas generations have passed away before me?” And they both seek Allah’s help and say to him, “May you be ruined, accept faith! Indeed Allah’s promise is true”; he therefore answers, “This is nothing except stories of former people.”

18.Faridul Haque: It is these upon whom the Word has proved true, among the nations that passed away before them, of jinns and men; indeed they were losers

19.Faridul Haque: And for all persons are ranks according to their deeds; and so that He may repay them in full for their deeds, and they will not be wronged

20.Faridul Haque: And on the day when the disbelievers will be presented upon the fire; it will be said to them, “You have wasted your portion of the good things in the life of this world and enjoyed them; so this day you will be repaid with the disgraceful punishment, the recompense of your wrongfully priding yourself in the land, and because you used to disobey.”

21.Faridul Haque: And remember the fellowman of the tribe of A’ad; when he warned his nation in the Ahqaf * - and indeed Heralds of warning passed away before and after him - that, “Do not worship anyone except Allah; indeed I fear the punishment of a Great Day upon you. (* A country among sand dunes.

22.Faridul Haque: They said, “Have you come to us in order to turn us away from our gods? Therefore bring upon us what you promise us, if you are truthful.”

23.Faridul Haque: He said, “Its knowledge is only with Allah; and I convey to you the messages of my Lord, but I perceive that you are an ignorant nation.”

24.Faridul Haque: So when they saw the punishment coming towards their valleys, spread like a cloud on the horizon, they said, “That is a cloud which will shower rain upon us”; said Hud “In fact this is what you were being impatient for; a windstorm carrying a painful punishment.”

25.Faridul Haque: “That destroys all things by the command of its Lord” - so at morning none could be seen except their empty houses; this is the sort of punishment We mete out to the guilty

26.Faridul Haque: And We had indeed given them the means which We have not given you, and made ears and eyes and hearts for them; so their ears and eyes and hearts did not benefit them at all because they used to deny the signs of Allah, and the punishment they used to mock at encompassed them

27.Faridul Haque: And We indeed destroyed townships surrounding you, and brought several signs so that they may desist

28.Faridul Haque: So why did they - the ones whom they had chosen as gods as a means of attaining Allah’s proximity - not help them? In fact the disbelievers lost them; and this is just their slander and fabrication

29.Faridul Haque: And when We sent a number of jinns towards you (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him), listening attentively to the Qur’an; so when they presented themselves there, they said to each other, “Listen quietly!”; and when the recitation finished, they turned back to their people, giving them warning

30.Faridul Haque: They said, “O our people! We have indeed heard a Book, sent down after Moosa, which confirms the Books preceding it, and guides towards the Truth and the Straight Path.”

31.Faridul Haque: “O our people! Listen to Allah’s caller and accept faith in Him, so that He may forgive you some of your sins and save you from the painful punishment.”

32.Faridul Haque: “And whoever does not listen to Allah’s caller cannot escape in the earth, and he has no supporters against Allah; they are in open error.”

33.Faridul Haque: Have they not realised that Allah, Who did not tire in creating the heavens and the earth and in creating them, is Able to revive the dead? Surely yes, why not? Indeed He is Able to do all things

34.Faridul Haque: And on the day when the disbelievers are presented upon the fire; it will be said, “Is this not a reality?” They will answer, “By oath of our Lord, surely yes, why not?”; it will be said, “Therefore taste the punishment, the recompense of your disbelief.”

35.Faridul Haque: Therefore patiently endure (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him) like the courageous Noble Messengers had endured, and do not be impatient for them; on the day when they see what they are promised, it will be as if they had not stayed on earth except part of a day; this is to be conveyed; will anyone be destroyed, except the disobedient

1.Faridul Haque: “Allah has destroyed the deeds of those who disbelieved and prevented from Allah’s way.”

2.Faridul Haque: “And those who accepted faith and did good deeds and believed in what has been sent down upon me, Mohammed (peace and blessings be upon him) - and that is the truth from their Lord - Allah has relieved them of some of their evils and refined their condition.”

3.Faridul Haque: This is because the disbelievers followed falsehood and the believers followed the Truth which is from their Lord; this is how Allah illustrates the examples of people to them

4.Faridul Haque: So when you confront the disbelievers, strike at their necks; until when you have slain them in plenty, tie them up firmly; then after that, you may either release them as a favour or take ransom, until the war lays down its ordeal; this is it; and had Allah willed He Himself could have taken revenge from them, but this is to test some of you with others; and Allah will surely never waste the deeds of those who were killed in His way

5.Faridul Haque: He will soon guide them (towards Paradise) and make them succeed

6.Faridul Haque: And He will admit them into Paradise - they have been made familiar with it

7.Faridul Haque: O People who Believe! If you help the religion of Allah, He will help you and will stabilise you

8.Faridul Haque: And for those who disbelieve - may they be ruined, and may Allah destroy all their deeds

9.Faridul Haque: This is because they disliked what Allah has sent down - He has therefore squandered all their deeds

10.Faridul Haque: So did they not travel in the land to see what sort of fate befell those who preceded them? Allah poured ruin upon them; and for the disbelievers are several like it

11.Faridul Haque: This is because Allah is the Supporter of the believers, whereas the disbelievers do not have any supporter

12.Faridul Haque: Allah will indeed admit those who believed and did good deeds into Gardens beneath which rivers flow; and the disbelievers enjoy, and they eat like the cattle eat, and their destination is in the fire

13.Faridul Haque: And many a township existed which was stronger than your town (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him) - those who removed you from your town - We destroyed them, so they do not have a supporter

14.Faridul Haque: So will one who is upon on a clear proof from his Lord, ever be like any of those whose evil deeds are made to appear good to them and they follow their own desires

15.Faridul Haque: A description of the Garden which is promised to the pious; in it are rivers of water which shall never pollute; and rivers of milk the taste of which shall never change; and rivers of wine delicious to drink; and rivers of purified honey; and in it for them are fruits of all kinds, and the forgiveness of their Lord; so will such ever be equal to those who are to stay in the fire for ever and who will be given boiling water to drink so that it tears their guts apart

16.Faridul Haque: And among them are some who listen to what you say; until when they go away from you, they say to those who have been given knowledge, “What did he say now?”; they are those whose hearts Allah has sealed, and they follow their own desires

17.Faridul Haque: And those who attained the right path - Allah increases the guidance for them and bestows their piety to them

18.Faridul Haque: So what are they waiting for, except that the Last Day suddenly come upon them? For its signs have already appeared; so when it does come, of what use is their realising it

19.Faridul Haque: Therefore know (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him) that there is none worthy of worship except Allah, and seek the forgiveness of sins of your close ones and for the common believing men and women; and Allah knows your movements during the day and your resting during the night

20.Faridul Haque: And the Muslims say, “Why was not a chapter sent down?” So when a positive chapter was sent down, and war was commanded in it, you will see those in whose hearts is a disease looking at you with the dazed looks of a dying man; so it would be better for them.

21.Faridul Haque: To obey and speak good; so when the manifest command came - it would have been better for them if they had remained faithful to Allah

22.Faridul Haque: So do you * portray that if you get governance, you would spread chaos in the land and sever your relations? (* The hypocrites

23.Faridul Haque: It is these whom Allah has cursed, so He made them deaf to the Truth and blinded their eyes

24.Faridul Haque: So do they not ponder the Qur’an deeply, or are there locks on some of their hearts

25.Faridul Haque: Indeed those who turn back after the guidance had become clear to them - Satan has deceived them; and made them optimistic of living for ages

26.Faridul Haque: This is because they said to those who dislike what Allah has sent down, “We will obey you regarding one matter *”; and Allah knows their secrets. (* To fight against the Holy Prophet)

27.Faridul Haque: So how (dreadful) will it be when the angels remove their souls, striking at their faces and their backs

28.Faridul Haque: This is because they followed the matter which displeases Allah, and they disliked what pleases Him - He therefore squandered away all their deeds

29.Faridul Haque: What! Do they, in whose hearts is a disease, fancy that Allah will not expose concealed enmities

30.Faridul Haque: And if We will, We can show them to you so that you may recognise them by their faces; and you will surely recognise them by the way they talk; and Allah knows your deeds

31.Faridul Haque: And We shall indeed test you until We make known the warriors and the steadfast among you - and to test your proclamations

32.Faridul Haque: Indeed those who disbelieved and prevented others from Allah’s way, and opposed the Noble Messenger after the guidance had become clear to them - they cannot harm Allah in the least; and soon He will squander away their deeds

33.Faridul Haque: O People who Believe! Obey Allah and obey the Noble Messenger, and do not render your deeds void

34.Faridul Haque: Indeed those who disbelieved and prevented others from Allah’s way, and then died as disbelievers - so Allah will never forgive them

35.Faridul Haque: Therefore do not relax, nor call towards truce by yourself; and it is you who will dominate; and Allah is with you, and He will never cause a loss in your deeds

36.Faridul Haque: The worldly life is just a sport and pastime; and if you accept faith and be pious, He will bestow your rewards to you, and not at all ask you for your wealth

37.Faridul Haque: Were He to ask it from you, and ask in plenty, you would be miserly, and the miserliness would expose the filth within your hearts

38.Faridul Haque: Yes, undoubtedly it is you who are being called, that you may spend in Allah’s way; so some among you act miserly; and whoever is miserly, is being a miser upon himself; and Allah is the Independent (Wealthy - Not requiring anything), whereas you all are needy; and if you renege, He will replace you with other people - and they will not be like you

1.Faridul Haque: We have indeed, for your sake (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him), bestowed a clear victory

2.Faridul Haque: So that Allah may forgive, for your sake, the sins of those before you and those after you, and complete His favours upon you, and to show you the Straight Path

3.Faridul Haque: And so that Allah may provide you a great help

4.Faridul Haque: It is He Who instilled peace in the hearts of the believers, so that it may increase their strength of conviction; and to Allah only belong the armies of the heavens and the earth; and Allah is All Knowing, Wise

5.Faridul Haque: In order to admit the believing men and believing women into Gardens beneath which rivers flow, in which they will abide, and to relieve them of their misdeeds; and this, in Allah’s sight, is the greatest success

6.Faridul Haque: And to punish the hypocrite men and hypocrite women, and the polytheist men and polytheist women, who think evilly about Allah; upon them only is the evil cycle of misfortune; and Allah has wreaked anger upon them, and has cursed them, and has prepared hell for them; and what an evil destination

7.Faridul Haque: And to Allah only belong the armies of the heavens and the earth; and Allah is Most Honourable, Wise

8.Faridul Haque: We have indeed sent you (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him) as a present witness and a Herald of glad tidings and warnings. (The Holy Prophet is a witness from Allah.

9.Faridul Haque: In order that you, O people, may accept faith in Allah and His Noble Messenger, and honour and revere the Noble Messenger; and may say the Purity of Allah, morning and evening. (To honour the Holy Prophet – peace and blessings be upon him – is part of faith. To disrespect him is blasphemy.

10.Faridul Haque: Those who swear allegiance to you (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him), do indeed in fact swear allegiance to Allah; Allah’s Hand* of Power is above their hands; so whoever breaches his oath, has breached his own greater promise; and whoever fulfils the covenant he has with Allah - so very soon Allah will bestow upon him a great reward. (Used as a metaphor to mean Allah’s power)

11.Faridul Haque: The ignorant ones who had stayed behind will now say to you, “Our wealth and our families prevented us from going by keeping us pre-occupied, therefore seek forgiveness for us”; they utter with their tongues what is not in their hearts; say, “So does anyone have any control over you against Allah, if He wills to harm you or provide you benefit? In fact Allah is Aware of what you do.”

12.Faridul Haque: “Rather you had assumed that the Noble Messenger and the Muslims will never return to their homes, and you thought this as good within your hearts, whereas you had thought evilly; and you were a people about to be ruined.”

13.Faridul Haque: And whoever does not accept faith in Allah and His Noble Messenger - We have indeed kept prepared a blazing fire for disbelievers

14.Faridul Haque: And for Allah only is the kingship of the heavens and the earth; He may forgive whomever He wills, and punish whomever He wills; and Allah is Oft Forgiving, Most Merciful

15.Faridul Haque: Those who had stayed behind will now say, “When you go to receive the war booty, let us also go with you”; they wish to change the Words of Allah; say “You shall never come with us - this is already decreed by Allah”; so they will now say, “But rather you envy us”; in fact they never understood except a little

16.Faridul Haque: Say to the ignorant who stayed behind, “You will soon be called against a nation of great military strength - to fight against them or that they become Muslims; so if you obey, Allah will give you an excellent reward; and if you turn away, the way you had turned away before, He will mete out a painful punishment to you.”

17.Faridul Haque: There is no reproach upon the blind, nor reproach against the lame, nor reproach upon the sick; and whoever obeys Allah and His Noble Messenger - Allah will admit him into Gardens beneath which rivers flow; and whoever turns away - He will mete out a painful punishment to him

18.Faridul Haque: Indeed Allah was truly pleased with the believers when they swore allegiance to you beneath the tree - so He knew what was in their hearts - He therefore sent down peace upon them, and rewarded them with an imminent victory

19.Faridul Haque: And plenty of war booty, to take; and Allah is Most Honourable, Wise

20.Faridul Haque: Allah has promised you plenty of booty which you will take, and has bestowed this to you quickly, and restrained peoples’ hands from you; and in order that it may be a sign for the believers, and to guide you on the Straight Path

21.Faridul Haque: And one more, not within your capacity, is within Allah’s hold; and Allah is Able to do all things

22.Faridul Haque: And if the disbelievers were to fight you, they will turn away and flee, and then they will not find any supporter nor any aide

23.Faridul Haque: The tradition of Allah, ongoing since before; and you will not find the tradition of Allah changing

24.Faridul Haque: And it is He Who restrained their hands from you, and your hands from them in the valley of Mecca, after having given you control over them; and Allah sees all what you do

25.Faridul Haque: It was these who disbelieved and prevented you from the Sacred Mosque, and stopped the sacrificial animals from reaching their place; and were it not for some Muslim men and Muslim women, whom you do not know - lest you may crush them and unintentionally incur some violation due to them - Allah would have permitted you to slay them; this relief for them, is so that Allah may admit into His mercy whomever He wills; and had they been separated, We would have indeed punished the disbelievers among them with a painful punishment

26.Faridul Haque: Whereas the disbelievers had set up in their hearts an obstinacy - the same obstinacy of the days of ignorance - so Allah sent down His solace upon His Noble Messenger and upon the believers, and decreed upon them the words of piety, and they were more deserving and suitable for it; and Allah is the All Knowing

27.Faridul Haque: Allah has indeed made the truthful dream of His Noble Messenger, come true; indeed you will all enter the Sacred Mosque, if Allah wills, in safety - with your heads shaven or hair cut short - without fear; so He knows what you do not know, and has therefore ordained another imminent victory before this

28.Faridul Haque: It is He Who has sent His Noble Messenger with the guidance and the true religion, in order to make it prevail over all other religions; and Allah is sufficient as a Witness. (The Holy Prophet is a light from Allah.

29.Faridul Haque: Mohammed (peace and blessings be upon him) is the Noble Messenger of Allah; and his companions are stern with the disbelievers and merciful among themselves - you will see them bowing and falling in prostration, seeking Allah’s munificence and His pleasure; their signs are on their faces, from the effects of their prostration; this trait of theirs is mentioned in the Taurat; and their trait is mentioned in the Injeel; like a cultivation that sprouted its shoot, then strengthened it, then thickened and then stood firm upon its stem, pleasing the farmer - in order to enrage the disbelievers with them; Allah has promised forgiveness and a great reward to those among them who have faith and do good deeds

49.SurahEnglishNames: The Private Apartments, The Inner Apartments, The Chambers

1.Faridul Haque: O People who Believe! Do not advance ahead of Allah and His Noble Messenger, and fear Allah; indeed Allah is All Hearing, All Knowing

2.Faridul Haque: O People who Believe! Do not raise your voices higher than the voice of the Prophet, nor speak to him loudly the way you shout to one another, lest your deeds go to waste whilst you are unaware. (Faith will go waste due to the slightest disrespect towards the Holy Prophet - peace and blessings be upon him. To honour him is part of faith. To disrespect him is blasphemy.

3.Faridul Haque: Indeed those who suppress their voices in the presence of Allah’s Noble Messenger, are the ones whose hearts Allah has tested for piety; for them is forgiveness, and a great reward

4.Faridul Haque: Indeed most of those who call you from outside the chambers do not have sense

5.Faridul Haque: And had they been patient until you yourself came out to them, it would be better for them; and Allah is Oft Forgiving, Most Merciful

6.Faridul Haque: O People who Believe! If any miscreant brings you some tidings, verify it, lest you unknowingly cause suffering to some people, and then remain repenting for what you did

7.Faridul Haque: And know that Allah’s Noble Messenger is among you; in most of the affairs, were he to listen to you, you would surely fall into hardship, but Allah has made faith dear to you and has instilled it in your hearts, and has made disbelief and rebellion and disobedience abhorred by you; it is people like these who are on guidance

8.Faridul Haque: The munificence and favour of Allah; and Allah is All Knowing, Wise

9.Faridul Haque: And if two groups of Muslims fight against each other, reconcile them; and if one of them oppresses the other, fight against the oppressor till it returns to the command of Allah; then if it returns, reconcile between them with justice, and be fair; indeed Allah loves the equitable

10.Faridul Haque: The Muslims are brothers to each other, therefore make peace between your two brothers and fear Allah, so that you may gain mercy. (The entire Muslim nation is a single brotherhood, without any distinction for caste, creed or colour.

11.Faridul Haque: O People who Believe! Men must not ridicule other men for it could be that the ridiculed are better than the mockers, nor must the women ridicule other women for the ridiculed women may be better than the mockers; and do not insult one another, nor assign evil nicknames; how base it is to be called a sinner after being a Muslim! And whoever does not repent - then it is they who are unjust

12.Faridul Haque: O People who Believe! Avoid excessive assumptions; indeed assumption sometimes becomes a sin, and do not seek faults, and do not slander one another; would any one among you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother? So you will hate that! And fear Allah; indeed Allah is Most Acceptor of Repentance, Most Merciful

13.Faridul Haque: O mankind! We have indeed created you from one man and one woman, and have made you into various nations and tribes so that you may know one another; indeed the more honourable among you, in the sight of Allah, is one who is more pious among you; indeed Allah is All Knowing, All Aware. (Piety is the basis of honour in Allah’s sight.

14.Faridul Haque: The ignorant said, “We have accepted faith”; say, (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him), “You have surely not accepted faith, but you should say ‘We have submitted’, for faith has not yet entered your hearts; and if you obey * Allah and His Noble Messenger, He will not reduce the reward of any of your deeds; indeed Allah is Oft Forgiving, Most Merciful.” (* By accepting faith and then obeying the commands)

15.Faridul Haque: The true believers are only those who accepted faith in Allah and His Noble Messenger and then did not have any doubt, and fought with their wealth and their lives in Allah’s way; it is they who are the truthful

16.Faridul Haque: Proclaim (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him), “Are you teaching Allah your own religion? Whereas Allah knows all whatever is in the heavens and all whatever is in the earth; and Allah knows all things.”

17.Faridul Haque: They portray that they are doing a great favour to you (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him) by having become Muslims; say, “Do not think that you have done me a favour by accepting Islam; in fact Allah has bestowed a favour upon you, for He guided you to Islam, if you are truthful.”

18.Faridul Haque: Indeed Allah knows all the hidden of the heavens and the earth; and Allah is seeing your deeds

1.Faridul Haque: Qaf; by oath of the Glorious Qur’an

2.Faridul Haque: Rather they were shocked that a Herald of Warning came to them from among themselves, so the disbelievers said, “This is something really strange.”

3.Faridul Haque: “When we are dead and have turned to dust, will we be raised again? That return is impossible!”

4.Faridul Haque: We know all what the earth decreases from them; and with Us is a Book that retains

5.Faridul Haque: In fact they denied the Truth when it came to them, so they are now in a dilemma

6.Faridul Haque: So did they not see the sky above them - how We have made it and beautified it, and there are no cracks in it

7.Faridul Haque: And (how) We have spread the earth, and placed mountains as anchors in it, and have grown all kinds of beautiful pairs in it

8.Faridul Haque: A perception and an understanding, for every bondman who inclines

9.Faridul Haque: And We sent down the auspicious water from the sky, therefore producing gardens with it, and the grain that is harvested

10.Faridul Haque: And high date-palms with lush fruit

11.Faridul Haque: As sustenance for the bondmen; and with it We revived a dead city; this is how you will be raised

12.Faridul Haque: Before these, the people of Nooh had denied, and so did the dwellers of Rass and the Thamud

13.Faridul Haque: And the tribe of A’ad, and Firaun, and the fellowmen of Lut

14.Faridul Haque: And the Dwellers of the Woods, and the people of Tubb’a; each one of them one denied the Noble Messengers, so My promised punishment proved true

15.Faridul Haque: So did We tire by creating the first time? Rather they doubt being created again

16.Faridul Haque: And indeed We have created man and We know what his soul instils in him; and We are nearer to him than the hearts artery

17.Faridul Haque: When the two Receiving Angels receive (his deeds), one seated on the right and one on the left

18.Faridul Haque: He does not utter a single word, without a ready recorder seated next to him

19.Faridul Haque: And the hardship of death came with the truth; “This is what you were escaping from!”

20.Faridul Haque: And the Trumpet was blown; “This is the Day of the promised punishment.”

21.Faridul Haque: And every soul came, along with a herder and a witness

22.Faridul Haque: “You were indeed neglectful of this, so We have removed the veil for you, and your eyesight is sharp this day.”

23.Faridul Haque: And his accompanying angel said, “This is the record of your deeds, available with me.”

24.Faridul Haque: It will be said to the angels, “Both of you fling every excessive ungrateful, stubborn person into hell.”

25.Faridul Haque: “The one who excessively prevented from virtue, the transgressor, the doubtful.”

26.Faridul Haque: “The one who appointed another God along with Allah – so both of you fling him into the severe punishment.”

27.Faridul Haque: His accompanying devil said, “Our Lord! I did not cause him to rebel, but he himself was in extreme error.”

28.Faridul Haque: He will say, “Do not dispute before Me – I had already warned you of the punishment.”

29.Faridul Haque: “With Me, the decree does not change, and nor do I oppress the bondmen.”

30.Faridul Haque: The day when We will ask hell, “Are you filled up?” and it will answer, “Are there some more?”

31.Faridul Haque: And Paradise will be brought close to the pious, not far away from them

32.Faridul Haque: This is what you are promised – for every repenting, careful person

33.Faridul Haque: Who fears the Most Gracious without seeing, and came with a heart that inclines

34.Faridul Haque: It will be said to him, “Enter it in peace; this is the day of eternity.”

35.Faridul Haque: In it for them is all that they may desire, and with Us is more than it

36.Faridul Haque: And many a generation We did destroy before them, who exceeded them in strength, therefore venturing in the cities! Is there a place to escape

37.Faridul Haque: Indeed in this is an advice for anyone who keeps a heart, or listens attentively

38.Faridul Haque: And We have indeed created the heavens and the earth, and all what is between them, in six days; and fatigue did not even approach Us

39.Faridul Haque: Therefore (O dear prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) patiently bear upon what they say, and praising your Lord say His Purity before the sun rises and before the sun sets

40.Faridul Haque: And say His Purity during the night, and after the customary prayers

41.Faridul Haque: And listen attentively on the day when an announcer will proclaim from a place nearby

42.Faridul Haque: The day when all will hear the Scream with the truth; this is the day of coming out of the graves

43.Faridul Haque: Indeed it is We Who give life, and give death, and towards Us only is the return

44.Faridul Haque: On the day when the earth will split for them, so they will come out in haste; this is the gathering - easy for Us

45.Faridul Haque: We well know what they say (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him), and you are not one to use force over them; therefore advise him with the Qur’an, whoever fears My threat

1.Faridul Haque: By oath of those which carry away while dispersing

2.Faridul Haque: Then by oath of those which carry the burdens

3.Faridul Haque: Then by oath of those which move with ease

4.Faridul Haque: Then by oath of those which distribute by the command

5.Faridul Haque: Undoubtedly, the promise you are given is surely true

6.Faridul Haque: And undoubtedly justice will surely be done

7.Faridul Haque: And by oath of the decorated heaven

8.Faridul Haque: You are indeed in different opinions regarding this Qur’an

9.Faridul Haque: Only those who are destined to revert, are reverted from it

10.Faridul Haque: Slain be those who mould from their imaginations

11.Faridul Haque: Those who have forgotten in a state of intoxication

12.Faridul Haque: They ask, “When will be the Day of Judgement?”

13.Faridul Haque: It will be on the day when they will be roasted in the fire

14.Faridul Haque: And it will be said to them, “Taste your own roasting; this is what you were impatient for.”

15.Faridul Haque: Indeed the pious are among Gardens and water springs

16.Faridul Haque: Accepting the rewards given by their Lord; they were indeed virtuous before this

17.Faridul Haque: They used to sleep only a little during the night

18.Faridul Haque: And used to seek forgiveness before dawn

19.Faridul Haque: And the beggar and the destitute had a share in their wealth

20.Faridul Haque: And in the earth are signs for those who are certain

21.Faridul Haque: And in your own selves; so can you not perceive

22.Faridul Haque: And in the heaven lies your sustenance, and the promise you are given

23.Faridul Haque: So by oath of the Lord of the heavens and the earth, this Qur’an is the Truth, in the same language that you speak

24.Faridul Haque: Did the news of Ibrahim’s honourable guests reach you (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him)

25.Faridul Haque: When they came to him and said, “Peace”; he answered, “Peace”; and thought, “These people are not familiar.”

26.Faridul Haque: Then he went to his home - so he brought a healthy calf

27.Faridul Haque: He then presented it before them and said, “Do you not eat?”

28.Faridul Haque: He therefore inwardly sensed fear of them; they said, “Do not fear!”; and they gave him the glad tidings of a knowledgeable son

29.Faridul Haque: So his wife came screaming, and striking her forehead cried, “What! For a barren old woman?”

30.Faridul Haque: They said, “This is how your Lord has decreed; indeed He only is the Wise, the All Knowing.”

31.Faridul Haque: Said Ibrahim, “What is your task, O the sent angels?”

32.Faridul Haque: They said, “We have been sent towards a guilty nation.”

33.Faridul Haque: “To throw upon them stones of baked clay.”

34.Faridul Haque: “That are kept marked, with your Lord, for the transgressors.”

35.Faridul Haque: So We removed the people who had faith, from that town

36.Faridul Haque: We therefore found just one house over there that was Muslim

37.Faridul Haque: And We kept a sign remaining in it, for those who fear the painful punishment

38.Faridul Haque: And in Moosa, when We sent him with a clear proof towards Firaun

39.Faridul Haque: In response, he turned away along with his army and said, “He is a magician or a madman.”

40.Faridul Haque: We therefore seized him and his army and threw them into the sea, while he was blaming himself

41.Faridul Haque: And in the tribe of A’ad, when we sent a dry windstorm upon them

42.Faridul Haque: It left out nothing in its path, but which it split up into fragments

43.Faridul Haque: And in the tribe of Thamud when it was told to them, “Enjoy for a while.”

44.Faridul Haque: In response they rebelled against their Lord’s command, so the thunderbolt seized them whilst they were watching

45.Faridul Haque: So they were neither able to stand up, nor were they able to take revenge

46.Faridul Haque: And before them, We destroyed the people of Nooh; they were indeed a sinning nation

47.Faridul Haque: And We have built the heaven with hands (the Divine Power), and it is We Who give the expanse

48.Faridul Haque: And We made the earth a base, so how well do We lay out

49.Faridul Haque: And We created all things in pairs, so that you may ponder

50.Faridul Haque: “Therefore rush towards Allah; indeed I am from Him, a clear Herald of Warning towards you.”

51.Faridul Haque: “And do not appoint other deities along with Allah; indeed I am from Him, a clear Herald of Warning towards you.”

52.Faridul Haque: Similarly, whenever a Noble Messenger came to those before them they always said, “He is a magician or a madman.”

53.Faridul Haque: What! Have they willed this utterance to one another? In fact they are a rebellious people

54.Faridul Haque: Therefore turn away from them (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him), - so there is no blame upon you

55.Faridul Haque: And advise, for advice benefits the Muslims

56.Faridul Haque: And I created the jinns and men, only for them to worship Me

57.Faridul Haque: I do not ask any sustenance from them, nor wish that they give Me food

58.Faridul Haque: Indeed it is Allah, Who is the Greatest Sustainer, the Strong, the Able

59.Faridul Haque: And indeed for these unjust is also a turn of punishment, like that of their companions - so they must not ask Me to hasten

60.Faridul Haque: So ruin is for disbelievers, from their day - which they are promised

1.Faridul Haque: By oath of (mount) Tur

2.Faridul Haque: And by oath of a passage, written

3.Faridul Haque: On an open record

4.Faridul Haque: And by oath of the Inhabited House

5.Faridul Haque: And the lofty roof

6.Faridul Haque: And the sea set aflame

7.Faridul Haque: Indeed your Lord’s punishment will surely take place

8.Faridul Haque: No one can avert it

9.Faridul Haque: A day on which the heavens will shake with a visible shaking

10.Faridul Haque: And the mountains will move with a visible movement

11.Faridul Haque: So on that day, ruin is for those who deny

12.Faridul Haque: Those who are playing in pursuits

13.Faridul Haque: A day when they will be pushed, forcibly shoved towards the fire of hell

14.Faridul Haque: “This is the fire, which you used to deny!”

15.Faridul Haque: “So is this magic, or are you unable to see?”

16.Faridul Haque: “Enter it – now whether you patiently bear it or are impatient - it is the same for you; for you is a recompense only for what you used to do.”

17.Faridul Haque: Indeed the pious are in Gardens and peace

18.Faridul Haque: Delighted at the bestowal of their Lord; and their Lord has saved them from the fire

19.Faridul Haque: “Eat and drink with pleasure, a reward for what you used to do.”

20.Faridul Haque: Reclining on thrones, in rows; and We have wedded them to maidens with gorgeous eyes

21.Faridul Haque: And those who accepted faith, and whose descendants followed them with faith - We have joined their descendants with them, and have not reduced anything for them from their deeds; every soul is trapped in its own deeds

22.Faridul Haque: And We aided them with fruit and meat, whatever they desire

23.Faridul Haque: In it, they accept cups from each other, in which is neither any lewdness nor any sin

24.Faridul Haque: And their boy servants shall go around them, as if they were pearls, safely hidden

25.Faridul Haque: And one of them turned towards the other, questioning

26.Faridul Haque: Saying, “Indeed before this, we were in our houses, worried.”

27.Faridul Haque: “So Allah did us a great favour, and saved us from the punishment of the flame.”

28.Faridul Haque: “Indeed we used to worship Him in our previous life; indeed He only is the Benign, the Most Merciful.”

29.Faridul Haque: Therefore (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him), enlighten, for by the munificence of your Lord, you are neither a soothsayer nor a madman

30.Faridul Haque: Or they allege, “He is a poet – we await a calamity of the times to befall him.”

31.Faridul Haque: Proclaim, “Go on waiting – I too am waiting along with you.”

32.Faridul Haque: Is this what their senses tell them, or are they a rebellious people

48.Faridul Haque: And be patient upon your Lord’s command, (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him), for you are indeed in Our sight; and proclaim the Purity of your Lord while praising Him, whenever you stand

1.Faridul Haque: By oath of the beloved shining star Mohammed (peace and blessings be upon him), when he returned from the Ascent

37.Faridul Haque: And of Ibrahim, who was most obedient

42.Faridul Haque: And that the end is only towards your Lord

44.Faridul Haque: And that it is He Who gave death and gave life

48.Faridul Haque: And that it is He Who has given wealth and contentment

54.Faridul Haque: So they were covered with whatever covered them

57.Faridul Haque: The approaching event has come near

58.Faridul Haque: None except Allah can avert it

59.Faridul Haque: So are you surprised at this fact

60.Faridul Haque: And you laugh, and do not weep

61.Faridul Haque: And you are lost in play

62.Faridul Haque: Therefore prostrate for Allah, and worship Him. (Command of Prostration # 12

1.Faridul Haque: The Last Day came near, and the moon split apart

20.Faridul Haque: Smashing down men as if they were uprooted trunks of date palms

22.Faridul Haque: And We have indeed made the Qur’an easy to memorise, so is there one who would remember

25.Faridul Haque: “What! Of all the men among us, the remembrance has come down upon him? In fact, he is a mischievous, great liar.”

30.Faridul Haque: So how did My punishment turn out, and My warnings

32.Faridul Haque: And We have indeed made the Qur’an easy to memorise, so is there one who would remember

35.Faridul Haque: As a reward from Us; this is how We reward one who gives thanks

49.Faridul Haque: We have indeed created all things by a proper measure

55.SurahEnglishNames: The Beneficent, The Mercy Giving, The Merciful

53.Faridul Haque: So O men and jinns! Which favour of your Lord will you deny

69.Faridul Haque: So O men and jinns! Which favour of your Lord will you deny

71.Faridul Haque: So O men and jinns! Which favour of your Lord will you deny

77.Faridul Haque: So O men and jinns! Which favour of your Lord will you deny
